social_posts.post_text:
Now for the fun part 🙃⤵️

Please introduce yourself (!) in the comments 🫶

Some other random facts about me 🙃: 

📰 I wanted to be Katie Couric when I grew up. 

🪄Was “that” Harry Potter girl throughout middle school - very positive Daniel Radcliffe was my first crush (got the lipgloss smears on the poster to prove it 🫠🥲)

💞Met my husband at a show in a pub my senior year of college (later learning we grew up less than a mile away from each other and went to the same schools). He was two years ahead of me - captain of the football team and I was the school news girl recording on the sidelines 🤓 true Taylor Swift style 

👦🏼👦🏻👦🏼 Definitely had to mourn the fact that I won’t have a daughter, but now I’m just feeling so grateful for my three boys. It’s next level energy but also next level sweetness. And they’re all so unique in their personalities and vibes. I’m just so thankful to witness the men they’ll become. 

🚩I hate board games. Idk if it’s my adhd or what but I’m happiest watching other people play… because explaining the rules to me is just nooone of my business 😅

Now it’s your turn in the comments. Introduce yourself and tell me a random fact. The weirder, the better 👽

➡️ And PS - if you want to get started establishing some simple routines in your family, comment “FLOW” and I’ll send you the link to my Home Flow Toolkit - all the routines and systems I use in my home (customizable to your own family!) 🫶

And if you’re new here, I’d love for you to follow along @motherboardpress 💞

The planner of my adhd mom-brain dreams ✨⤵️

I’ve been a mom now for almost 8 years (my kids are now 3, 5, and 7) and a working adult for almost 10. 

And in the beginning, it was *rough* 🫠

It felt like life just kept throwing balls at me and I had to figure out (quickly!!) which we’re glass and which were plastic when they fell. 

I made this planner + thought organizer after almost a decade of trial-and-error (and endless scattered notebooks), and I truly has been such a grounding force for my all-over-the-place mom-brain 🙃

I didn’t ever need (or have time for) all the fancy stickers or overwhelming checklists… I just needed something simple to organize all the systems to keep my home and life afloat (with plenty of scribble room)! 

So I made it for myself, and then some friends… and now for you! I’m so happy you’re here 🙃

The 2024 Motherboard Planner includes: 

⭐️ Yearly and monthly reflection and goal-setting 
⭐️ Monthly view to see the big picture 
⭐️ Weekly view with days in columns to visualize how your day will flow 
⭐️ Daily systems for chores, laundry, maintaining friendships, and moving your body (endorphins!) 
⭐️ In between EACH WEEK, pages include thought organizers for your weekly tasks, a weekly brain dump, and a double-sided grocery list for you to tear out and take with you to the store 

➡️ Comment “MB” and I’ll send you the link to preorder yours - they will be shipping out end of November, just in time for the holidays! ✨
I am only selling one production run, so grab yours (and one for your sister!) before they sell out again! 

#motherhood #motherhoodunplugged #realmom #motherhoodunfiltered #morningvlog #vlog #morningroutine #routinesforfamilies #honestmom #momtips#momhacks #momofthree #boymomofthree #momofthreeboys #newmom #newmomlife #plannerformoms #momplanner

can’t believe I shared that screenshot 🫣🫠

But for real, this weekly system has been holding down the fort for years now 💪

And really came from a place of a lot of pain, struggle, feeling like there must be just something wrong with me that I couldn’t figure out how to hack it - like I’m barely taking care of myself, how can I take care of my family 😔 

Once I finally figured out the exact tools and systems I needed to support me and my unique brain, everything shifted in the best ways possible. 🥲

Obviously no week is ever perfect or goes perfectly to plan, but it has been such a relief (!) having a system that takes over so much of the mental weight that goes with planning and just a bumper to fall back on. 

Hopefully me sharing this will make the path a little smoother for someone else 🫶

Also real talk - how many Notes are on your phone?? I feel like my 367 is a reasonable number 🥴

➡️ PS you can comment “MB” and I’ll send you the link to my Motherboard Planner 🤍! 
I’m only selling one production run for 2024 and still have some left — would be an amazing gift for yourself or the moms in your life 🙃

burn out / mom / motherhood / adult adhd / adhd woman / adhd in motherhood / adhd in women / planner for adhd / planner tour / weekly routine / family routine / educational psychology

Here it is ⬇️

If you find yourself *knowing* what you need to do to feel in control of your home, but just can’t seem to get yourself to *actually* do it… 

I got you. 

This was me for years (!) trying to navigate becoming a mom, figuring out my adult adhd diagnosis, and just juggling all the tasks and responsibilities life just kept seeming to throw my way. 

Once I finally applied my professional training and education as a Master of Ed to my own life and home, everything shifted in the best ways possible. 🤯

And no, I’m not just going to tell you to stick a chore chart on your wall and hope for the best 🫠🙃

It really comes down to a shift in mindset, setting your priorities and realistic expectations, and using systems and routines that work with your own unique brain (considering research in habit formation and motivation theory) to get your family on the path you *actually* want to be on. 

Creating the family story you truly want. 

If you’re new here, welcome 🤗 I’d love for you to join our amazing community  @motherboardpress - where we’re just tryna bring our best, together 🙃🫶💫

PS - you can comment “MENU” to get started with some of my free (!) templates to customize for your own family, starting with our Morning Menus - a simple morning routine your kids can look forward to while you get together breakfast - a nice way to start the day with a simple rhythm and connection 🫶🤍

here goes nothin 🙃✨👽 

thank you sooo much to all of you here supporting me - can’t believe you pre-ordered over 500 Motherboard planners 🥹😭🤍

and my heart is just seriously doing flips printing out these labels going all over the country and all over the world 

so obsessed with the community we’re creating - current world headquarters in my garage 🕴️🌎💫

📍 would be so fun for you to tell me in the comments where you’re Motherboarding from ?? 

also I have about 300 planners left, so if you haven’t grabbed yours yet, now is the time!! 💫

#plannerlove #planner #adhdwomen #adhdplanner #momplanner #momplanners #plannerformoms

sooo much to be thankful for this year 🥹😭🤍 

but at the top of the list is YOU - thank you for finding me and all our chats and all your encouragement and support 

I seriously have butterflies dropping off these packages at the post office just because I already can’t wait to hear from you and need to know what you think 🙃🥲💫

hope you get to soak up some warm moments with the people you love today 🤍

8 years as mrs. williamson today 🥲💫🤍 

and somehow more obsessed with him than ever

just really proud of us 🙃 

and so very thankful to have this man in my corner

you can find me in the garage aka MB world headquarters 💫🌎💌

seriously sooo blown away by all your preorders 😭 and I’ve been working like a little elf trying to get them all out — 

be on the lookout for your shipping confirmation 🙃🤍

also if you haven’t ordered yet - I have a little less than 300 left, so now is the time!! 🤍

planner / small business / mom planner / motherhood planner / home management planner / home planner / gift for mom / best gift for mom / mother / adhd planner / adhd tools / adhd mom

life changing laundry systems 💫↙️

okay I don’t know about you but for YEARS the pile-of-doom laundry situation has been my standard operating procedure 😅

and idk if it’s my adhd or what but I can’t count the number of times I would wash a load and then it would sit in the washer for days 😵‍💫😵‍💫 and then I would rewash it…. and forget it again 💀

with three kids (5 whole people’s laundry!) cycling through - I just finally got to a breaking point where I had to figure it out 

like yes, it’s hard to do laundry… but it’s *just* as hard (if not harder!) to live in the chaos of dirty laundry and where-are-my-socks and piles all over the place … I’d rather the “hard” be serving me if that makes sense?

so here is exactly what I have figured out that has changed the laundry game in my home:

💫 laundry is an everyday task — that doesn’t mean a whole load a day (because I don’t think that’s possible if you work outside the home), but it *does* mean I need to be doing on laundry-related task a day. I usually alternate days between washing/drying and then the next day folding/putting away

💫 DELAY WASH is an angel sent from above — especially if you have adhd like me. I know not all washing machines have this, but if you do, you are seriously so lucky(!!). this means you can put a load in at night and delay the wash to start first thing in the morning, so when you wake up, you can immediately put it in the dryer and your laundry task for the day is done 🏆

💫 don’t fold little kids clothes — seriously the biggest waste of time in my opinion. when kids clothes are still small enough (my kids are 3, 5, and 7) to where they can lay mostly flat in the drawer, you will save sooo much time and stress just laying them flat instead of folding all the tiny pieces 

💫 have one color sock — we’re slowly getting here but matching socks are the bane of my laundry life (😤) so I’m slowly moving to just ONE type of socks for the boys so I can just throw them all in their drawer

anything else I am missing?? 

➡️ PS if this has been helpful to you, you can comment “FLOW” and I’ll send you the link to my Home Flow Toolkit 💫🙃✨

just wanna share for 5-years-ago me - wish I could give her a hug right now 🤍

and tell her it’s all going to be okay 

you just need the right tools 

and your confidence in mothering will grow with time and practice 🤍

if you’re in the thick of it, just know I see you and know you’re definitely not alone

you have amazing power within you to understand yourself 

and power to carry that understanding into the actions and in turn, life you really want 💫🫶

getting back in the swing of early mornings again this week because I have been in a funkkkk and I know it’s because I haven’t been getting those endorphins (and have learned about myself that if I don’t do it first thing I just don’t do it at all 🫠) 

also just want to note that there have been *many* seasons of my life where this morning routine doesn’t make sense (I’m looking at you moms of babies still waking you up at night!!) 

but the biggest shift in every type of season for me has come from: 

💫clearly defining what I need to feel/do my best, what’s most important to me right now 

💫figuring out a realistic way to make that happen 

💫blocking my time in a way that makes sense for my particular seasons needs and reality (sleep schedules, school and work schedules, activities, etc.) 

and I truly couldn’t do that without my MB planner 

I usually spend about 20 minutes once a week strategizing my week ahead (looking at what we have going on, meals were going to want, prioritizing tasks and habits, etc.) 

and then just check in with my planner first thing in the morning for like 3 minutes just to remind me what to do with my hands that day to accomplish my bigger goals (hi adhd brain)

already 556 of you have the MB planner coming your way 🥹✨😭 and I can’t wait to have friends joining me in this practice because it’s really truly changed my motherhood experience 

➡️ if you haven’t grabbed yours yet, comment “MB” and I’ll DM you the link! 💌🫶
I have a little over 200 left for 2024 and won’t be making any more until 2025 💫

🥲🥺 if this isn’t the truth…

honestly had no idea when starting my climb from my lowest point 3 years ago just how deep I’d have to go

it seemed like very surface-level, functional changes — like how in the hell do I do all this, take care of these three souls, keep my house from feeling like a pit of chaos, keep track of these events and papers, etc… 

but what I didn’t realize at the time was that the biggest shift that needed to happen was the story I was telling myself about myself 🥺

that I *am* in fact capable 

I *am* the perfect mom for my kids 

I *can* follow through 

I *can* do this 

I just need the right tools and some practice 🤍

my MB planner was the first tool I created for myself to start to shift my own story 

it truly was the tipping point that started giving me the confidence that it was all going to be okay 

starting to get messages from the 587 of you who have started to get your MB planners in the mail has seriously made me teary — I am just filled with so much love for you and hope for all of us 🫶🤍 this year is going to be full of it 

💫 if you haven’t grabbed your 2024 MB planner yet, you can comment “MB” and I’ll DM you the link! 
I have a little over 200 left, and I won’t be making any more until 2025 🥲

comment “MB” to grab your own Motherboard for 2024! 💫✨🤍 join over 600 of us starting our practice this year 🥹 — I have a little over 150 left and won’t be making any more until 2025! 

this was the first tool I made for myself after reaching my lowest point feeling completely overwhelmed and out of control (and frankly incapable of keeping up with all the tasks life kept throwing my way)

she’s basically been my sidekick since 🙃 and I really don’t know where I’d be without her 

it’s funny because when I usually first tell people about my planner, their first reaction is always “wow, you’re so organized!” 

and I just lol because by nature, no (!!) I am really really not 💀

but that’s why I made MB - to give me a tool to prop me up and support me in the ways that don’t come naturally to me… to get me going in the direction I really want and ultimately the life I really desire for myself and my family 🤍

makes my heart absolutely sing to have so many new friends (over 600?!) to join me this year 🥲🫶💫🤍

can confirm that Morning Cari loves this girl 🥲☝🏻

had a few people asking what my nights look like to prep for early mornings — and firstly, want to say just yes to this truth (which has rocked my world)💫

the key to smooth days really is in the previous night ✨

and while it takes a little time and repetition, once you start to FEEL the reward in the mornings of having so many things set up for yourself (and especially acknowledging that reward) —this is how you will close that reward loop and create habits that stick 💪

which is partly why I always thank Night Time Cari out loud every morning just to reinforce in my brain 🙃🫠🤍

we go way more in depth on this — the behavioral science of motivation and habit formation and how to apply to your home life — in my Home Flow Toolkit✨ along with practical customizable tools to create your own flows for your family 

💫if you’re ready to start the new year in a new way, you can comment “NEW YEAR” and I’ll DM you the link to a special offer for the Home Flow Toolkit 🙃🫶✨

feeling stuck? start here ⬇️

for years, I really thought something must be broken inside me that I could never follow through 

I’m a big picture, dreamer kind of gal — so many new ideas, so many big goals and projects ✨

but when it came to actually showing up and *doing* and executing those ideas… I felt like I was always buffering at 25%

once I started learning more about my adult ADHD diagnosis and how it affects executive functioning (being able to organize your thoughts and prioritize tasks), everything made so much more sense. 

I learned that I truly *need* tools and systems to relieve that mental load from my days. 

the biggest shift this has created for me has come from: 

💫clearly defining what I need to feel/do my best, what’s most important to me right now 

💫figuring out a realistic way to make that happen 

💫blocking my time in a way that makes sense for my particular seasons needs and reality (sleep schedules, school and work schedules, activities, etc.) 

and I truly couldn’t do that without my MB planner 

I usually spend about 20 minutes once a week strategizing my week ahead (looking at what we have going on, meals were going to want, prioritizing tasks and habits, etc.) 

and then just check in with my planner first thing in the morning for like 3 minutes just to remind me what to do with my hands that day to accomplish my bigger goals (hi adhd brain)

already over 700 of you have the MB planner coming your way 🥹✨😭 and I can’t wait to have friends joining me in this practice because it’s really truly changed my motherhood experience 

➡️ if you haven’t grabbed yours yet, comment “MB” and I’ll DM you the link! 💌🫶
I have a little less than 100 (!?) left for 2024 and won’t be making any more until 2025 💫

my biggest ick 🫠 when scrolling through IG is people reminding me to ~enjoy the moment~ with my kids because this time is fleeting

like I don’t already feel the time slipping through my hands like water. 

I know these posts are well-intentioned, but it feels a little insensitive, almost. Because I know where that path leads, in my experience…

guilt, followed by overwhelm, followed by guilt again. 

once I finally realized the reason I was having trouble being present in the moment with my kids was because I didn’t have the 

mental space 

or energy to do so, it changed everything.

after years of struggling, I finally figured out that having systems as guardrails for my “house managing” tasks (as well as a tool to keep me grounded - my MB planner) automated and simplified so much of my brain power, actually giving me the space and freedom to *truly* enjoy the moments…

because I know there is a way for me to do it. 

👉 Ready to create your own automations and flow for your family? Comment “MB” and I’ll DM you the link to my (almost sold out 😮‍💨) 2024 Motherboard Planner. 
This has all the tools and systems I’ve implemented to finally find a flow after years of chaos in one succinct, simple ready-to-use journal you can use for your own family 🤍

their voices during storytime>> also just wanna pinch myself that my oldest has started wanting to read to the littles at night - I don’t think three-years-ago-me could have even comprehended that as being a reality just so deep in the everyone-neeeeeds-me-all-the-time but now I just looked up and here we are 🥲

it gets physically so much lighter (heavier in other ways) but wow 

had a few people ask to see what our evening routines look like before the kids bedtime so just wanted to share that it’s always a little different 

feeling this especially now as we’re entering a new season of after school practices and activities etc. 

but our routines and rhythms always give us just like a base line (or bumpers) to get back to moving us along in the right direction 

and taking care of our tomorrow-selves (probably the most life-changing part) 🤍

you can comment “MENU” and I’ll send you some of my free (!) AM/PM routine print-outs ✨🫶 to add some bumpers to your own nights and mornings

ending the year with some big takeaways…

💫 just because something doesn’t come easily, doesn’t mean it’s not for you 

💫 being a martyr for motherhood isn’t good for anyone (me, my partner, or my kids)

💫 100% of the time, the anticipation or worry is worse than actually just doing the thing (and ignoring the thing will never make it actually go away lol)

💫 following-through is a practice (it’s not always perfect but it CAN be strengthened and get better over time with the right support)

💫 letting go of others’ perceptions and realizing we’re all just on our own lil journey is one of the most freeing experiences in life 

💫 failure is essential for success in anything (and truly successful people are just the ones who keep pushing through to find the lesson)

but mostly, I think my biggest takeaway from this year is just the power in speaking out big intentions and the confidence that builds with the baby steps leading towards them 🥲💪

I’m about to finally sit down and write some goals for this next year - and I’m so happy you’re here with me 🥹🤍

would love for you to let me know your 2024 goals in the comments below 🫶

gotta refuel that Christmas magic tank girl ✨ and it doesn’t have to be anything crazy 

💫go for a walk in your neighborhood 
💫meet a friend and use the childwatch at the gym 
💫 try on some new lip colors at Sephora 
💫 take a bath with some hot cocoa and a book
💫 get in bed early, light a candle, and read a book 
💫 call your friend and bounce holiday ideas off each other 
💫 take a minute and go thrifting/ to the antique store even just to take pics or things that inspire you 
💫 do a lil hobby like a home project 
💫 sneak away for a dinner with your boo
💫 notice the sky / start collecting pics or the sunset and sunrises 
💫 make yourself a hot tea at night 
💫 take time to wash your face 

just know this time is crazy but putting yourself on the back shelf doesn’t really do anyone favors 🤍

we’re all sick over here so I’ve been taking like hours-long baths with a new addictive book series as soon as my kids are in bed 🙃

what’s your favorite way to take care of yourself right now?

I kid you not there were *years* that I had convinced myself that I was just always going to feel like I was two steps behind in life 

as a mom to 3 with an adult adhd diagnosis, there were days (months lol) where I felt like there was just absolutely no way I would ever get ahead of all of the demands and responsibilities it felt like life kept throwing my way to catch 😮‍💨

it took me hitting a pretty painful rock bottom to finally realize that this was just a (pretty terrible) story I was telling myself. 

that I would never know what I was doing.
that I just was always going to feel all-over-the place.
that I would never actually feel like “the grown up” in charge.

but I decided I wanted to start writing a different story for my family. one where I felt empowered in my own intuition and my ability to figure anything out… I just needed the right support and tools to get there. 

I started adding those tools and systems, one by one, building over time as I felt more and more capable and confident. 

now, more valuable than anything, these baby steps have led me to a place where I have such peace of mind knowing that my time reflects the building blocks leading to my ultimate goals and values. 

and now I get to share that peace of mind with others (so far over 1000 other women 🥹🥲💫) 🫶

➡️ if you’re ready to write a new story for yourself and your family this year, you can comment “NEW YEAR” and I’ll DM you a link to a special offer on my Home Flow Toolkit ✨ - this has all the customizable tools and systems for your home (as well as mindset work and behavioral science to make changes stick) 🤍

just wish I had known this sooner 😵‍💫

can’t even tell you (and honestly embarrassed to admit) how many years I would go through this cycle: 

➡️ say omg we gotta stop eating out so much, I’m planning meals for this week 

➡️ scour Pinterest for an hour or two

➡️ get a giant load of groceries 

➡️ head into our week with the best intentions and then get slammed in the face with all our activities and busy schedule 

➡️ be too busy or tired or not have the time to make said planned meals, cave and order takeout anyways 

➡️ end up throwing away sooo much food, feel so guilty, and say omg we gotta stop eating out so much…

and the (wasteful, expensive $!) cycle continues 💀

it wasn’t until the past year that I figured out the missing piece - and this one shift (finally!) broke that cycle:

💫 using my planner to plan our weekly meals 💫

first, I look at what our week looks like - what days we have activities in the afternoon, what nights we have basketball practice (ok need either leftovers or grilled cheeses or something cooking in the crockpot that day)

then, I look at the weather for the week (it’s raining on Tues, better not plan to grill out that night - or it’s weirdly warm on Mon, better not plan for soup because we won’t want that) 

and lastly, I look at what I already have in my pantry/fridge/freezer to see if there’s anything that needs using before it goes bad 

I usually do this on Thursdays so I can order groceries to be picked up on Friday - and then we have food for the weekend and whatever we need to prep on Sunday for the week ahead 

such a simple shift but it has been the golden ticket for our home 💫🤯

💌➡️ send this to your partner if this is something you want to try this year! 

and if you want to learn more about starting some new home routines and rhythms that stick, you can comment “NEW YEAR” and I’ll DM you a special offer for my Home Flow Toolkit ✨ - all the customizable tools and systems that have transformed my home (and now over 1000 other families!) 🫶

did you catch my Donnie Thornberry brushing his teeth? 🥲🙃

it’s honestly so weird watching this back and makes my heart swell (a lot) just reflecting on how far we’ve come 

there were so many years where our nights had the complete opposite vibe - full of stress, chaos, feeling like we were doing all we could but really not accomplishing anything… 

feeling like there just must be something wrong with me that I couldn’t just figure it out 😞

turns out I was just missing two big pieces:

💫clearly defining my values for my family in our unique season and 

💫 giving myself the tools and systems I need to support myself in making our time align with those values and goals 

(every word there important^)

once I finally applied my training in learning theory and motivational science from my Masters of Ed to our home life… everything shifted in the best ways 🤯🥲

and now I have the joy and mission to share that understanding and peace of mind with others (over 1000 families so far 🤯🥹) — hopefully making the path a little smoother for someone else 🤍

SAVE this for a batch breakfast (or after-school snack) that only takes about 20 minutes to whip together and saves you a bunch of dishes (and is a great way to use those browning bananas) 🙃💫🤍

if the measurements seem weird, it’s because this is technically a double-batch, so feel free to cut it in half if you only want to make a single! 

BANANA OAT PROTEIN PANCAKES 🥞 

2 ripe bananas
1 cup almond milk
4 eggs
2 egg whites
4 tbsp maple syrup
3 cups rolled oats*
4 tsp baking powder
1 tsp salt
2 tsp vanilla extract
2 tsp cinnamon
2 tbsp ground flax seed (optional)

put all ingredients into the blender, blend until decently smooth, then flip on the stovetop in some melted butter or coconut oil (add some choco chippies with your heart) - these cook a little slower than “normal” pancakes, so give them a minute or two before the flip

you can save these in the fridge for the week or put them in the freezer for a few months! 

paired with a big glass of milk or smeared with some peanut butter - makes me feel good that my kids are fueled and satisfied before heading off for their days 🤍💪

I’m always looking for new simple recipes to batch for our meals - gives me one less thing taking away from my brain power during the week

let me know in the comments if you have a favorite thing to batch! 

*these can be made gluten free and dairy free - just be sure to use gluten free oats and melted coconut oil on the stovetop!

I got you 💪…

this was me for years

as a mom to 3 and diagnosed with adhd as an adult, the beginning of my motherhood (really adulthood) journey was *rough* to say the least 

for a while, I really thought there was just something intrinsically wrong with me that I couldn’t figure it all out (how to keep our home functioning, how to not feel so scattered all over the place, how to not feel like I was completely spinning my wheels)… 

after finally hitting a pretty low (and painful) point, I finally had an epiphany: 

as a teacher, I truly believed any student can learn with the right scaffolding and support… why can’t that apply to myself and my own life as well?

I started applying my knowledge from my Masters in Ed — motivational and behavioral science, as well as learning theories — to my home life… and everything shifted in the best ways possible 🥲

little changes at first, then building on those changes and that confidence over time 💪💫

bringing the most wonderful peace of mind and peace in our home 🤍

and now I have the joy and privilege of sharing this shift with others (over 1000 families so far🥹🫶)

the magic formula… 

ever put something off (forever) because you just feel paralyzed by the effort you think it’s going to take?

that was seriously *me* 🙋‍♀️for years when it came to cleaning my house

once  I finally applied my knowledge from my Masters in Ed (specifically motivation theories and habit formation) to my home life… it was such a lightbulb moment 💡

a big thing is, when you want to make a habit of something… you need to make it:

💫 as obvious as possible (my Home Binder)
💫 as enjoyable as possible (listening to my audiobooks)
💫 as easy as possible (these cleaning caddies!)

so here’s the full list of how I stock my caddies (btw these exact caddies are currently $5 in the Target dollar spot!): 

• glass cleaner
• all purpose cleaner
• disinfecting wipes (for the toilet)
• a cup for rinsing the shower
• tile scrubber, grout scrubber, tub scrubber 
• microfiber cloths 
• disposable gloves
• a sponge
• trash bag refills for taking out bathroom trash (these are simple human size A)
• magic erasers 
*I also use the disposable toilet cleaner wand that just stays in each bathroom

be sure your caddy is in an *easy-to-access* place because if you have to dig to the back of a closet or cabinet to get to it… you won’t (learned from experience 🙃)

save this list to take with you to Target 🎯- and follow along for part II! 

➡️ And if you’re ready to finally make these habits stick for the long-run, you can comment “FLOW” and I’ll DM you the link to my Home Flow Toolkit that over 1000 families have already started implementing 💫🫶

#cleaningcaddy #cleaningsupplies #cleancariseries

here’s the recipe 💫✨

the realization I had this past year that the simplest cleaning supplies really do the best work, don’t leave me gasping for air, AND save a ton of money 🤯

also makes me feel better using around my puppy and three little kids 

here’s my go-to all purpose spray (I use this one for spraying down the shower and tub and sinks - works great for breaking down soap scum):

• 1 part dawn dish soap 
• 1 part white vinegar 

that’s it 🤯

I use these glass spray bottles I grabbed at Target - but any spray bottle will work! 

🚫 also DO NOT use this on your natural stone (marble, granite) counters as the vinegar will erode away any sealant and eventually the stone 

have you tried this??

hi! I’m Cari - mom to three little boys, former high school English teacher, and by nature.. a whirlwind of disorganized chaos 🫠

I’m an enneagram 7, diagnosed adhd, and projector in human design… and for a while, I thought that meant that I was just destined  to be a pretty shitty mom. 

like there was just something intrinsically *wrong* with me that I couldn’t figure how to do it all. 

it look me hitting that pretty low (and painful) point in my motherhood journey to realize that that was just a (pretty terrible) story I was telling myself 

and I really just needed the right tools and systems (and practice) to support me in building the life I really wanted for myself and my family 🤍

since then, I’ve experienced the most incredible shift in my life — and now I have the joy and privilege of sharing what I’ve learned with others (over 1000 families so far 🥹💫🫶)
